content: Another small bit of celebration for Dana Scott's 90th Birthday: the Peripatetic Seminar on Sheaves and Logic (PSSL) is an informal meeting of categorists, type theorists and logicians, started in 1976 by Dana Scott, while in Oxford. There's now a nLab page for it, but we only have the titles of the talks till the 100th PSSL. We're missing the last 5 meetings and help providing webpages or listings of the talks for these missing meetings would be much appreciated!
I added the links from @Nathanael Arkor to the nLab page

Valeria de Paiva said:

Another small bit of celebration for Dana Scott's 90th Birthday: the Peripatetic Seminar on Sheaves and Logic (PSSL) is an informal meeting of categorists, type theorists and logicians, started in 1976 by Dana Scott, while in Oxford. There's now an nLab page, but we only have the titles of the talks till the 100th PSSL. We're missing at least 5 meetings and help providing webpages or listings of the talks for these missing meetings would be much appreciated!

oops - page not found!
This zulip has a nice syntax extension where you can just type the name of an nLab page in double-brackets, like you do on the nLab itself: [[Peripatetic Seminar on Sheaves and Logic]].
